entry.title: Mass rallies against Azerbaijanโs blockade in Yerevan and Stepanakert

media:group.media:title: Mass rallies against Azerbaijanโs blockade in Yerevan and Stepanakert
media:group.media:description:
๐The foreign ministers of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Russia will meet in Moscow tomorrow for another round of negotiations. ๐Organizers are planning simultaneous mass rallies in Yerevan and Stepanakert tomorrow to call on Azerbaijan to lift its seven-month blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh. ๐The International Committee of the Red Cross evacuated 11 people from Nagorno-Karabakh to Armenia for medical treatment. ๐Russian peacekeepers refused to allow a group of Nagorno-Karabakh residents to enter the region from Armenia via the Lachin corridor. ๐Armeniaโs tech entrepreneurs gathered at Lake Sevan for this yearโs Sevan Startup Summit.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: A walk through the streets of blockaded Karabakh

media:group.media:title: A walk through the streets of blockaded Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Today, it is rare to see cars passing through the streets in Nagorno Karabakh (Artsakh). The region has been under a total blockade for more than seven months. Last month, Azerbaijan also banned the entry of humanitarian goods to Karabakh. Without fuel, Stepanakertโs public transportation is almost non-existent, and regional transportation is operating with a limited schedule. Let's take a walk through Stepanakertโs central streets to get a glimpse of the peopleโs daily reality.

entry.title: Armenia working to comply with Russia sanctions: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia working to comply with Russia sanctions: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
๐A number of senior Armenian government officials have stressed that Armenia is working to comply with international sanctions against Russia. ๐Armenia is building a checkpoint on its side of a key bridge to Turkey, even though there is still no date for the two countriesโ border to reopen. ๐Armenia said it had not received a purported letter from Azerbaijan demanding a halt to the construction of a scrap metal plant on the two countriesโ border.
